CITY OF CINCINNATI,
Office of Chief of Police, Septr 23d 1865
To his Excellency
Gov F, C, Bramlette
Dear Sir

Permit me to introduce to you the bearer Miss Maggie DeBeck of our City she is an estimable lady and respectibly connected -- she visits Frankfort interfered in behalf of Geo. C. Barnes now in your Penitentiary sentenced for ten years the half which he has now served out -- I have Known him for a number of years and considered him more misguided than criminal, he has influencial but think and distance prevented him from applying to them I can cheerfully say that I consider him a suitable subject for executive "clemency" and if consistant with your duty to "pardon" him I think he will endevour to become once again a worty member
of society as he has been most severly punished for his indiscression.

I am your respectfully
Jas L Ruffin
Chief of Police
